---

### Government Tender Announcement

#### Government Tender Title and Reference ID
Title: Computer Basde Task Professional Services
Reference: cb-522-57570408

#### Solicitation Information
Solicitation Reference: E60ZT-18TSPS/D
Publication Date: 2024-07-24
Closing Date: 2028-07-04
Amendment Date: 2024-07-24

#### Tender Description
The government of Canada is soliciting proposals for task-based professional services, excluding IT-related services, under the Task and Solutions Professional Services (TSPS) arrangement. This solicitation is part of the Government of Canada's procurement strategy for mandating advisory services from qualified suppliers.

#### Scope and Schedule
Task-based professional services will be delivered under the TSPS arrangement for a period of four years, commencing from the date of issuance. This solicitation allows existing suppliers to pre-qualify for additional categories, streams, tiers, regions, and metropolitan areas under the TSPS arrangement.

#### Requirements and Conditions
- Suppliers must pre-register in the Supplier Module of the PWGSC Centralized Professional Services System (CPSS).
- Suppliers must submit bids online via the CPSS e-Portal prior to the deadline.
- Suppliers must provide supporting documentation, if requested, via email.
- The TSPS arrangement will be valid for a period of four years from the date of issuance.

#### Eligibility Criteria
- Suppliers must meet the standards and requirements of the TSPS arrangement.
- Suppliers must submit a sealed bid by the closing date and time of the solicitation.

#### Procedural Requirements
- Queries regarding the solicitation must be directed to the Purchasing Manager, Julie C. Morin at TPSGC.spts-tsps.PWGSC@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca.
- All documentation may be submitted in either official language of Canada.
- The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers and may select the company that best meets the requirements of this solicitation.

### Trade Agreements and Business Practices
- This procurement opportunity is subject to the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA).
- Suppliers wishing to participate in this solicitation must familiarize themselves with the trade agreements, rules, and regulations associated with this solicitation.

#### Market Research
- The client department will conduct research to determine the various prices suppliers have proposed for this solicitation.
- Suppliers will be selected based on these prices.

### Contact Information
- Contact: Julie
